name: Pebble Beach Golf Links
description: Iconic coastal golf course on the Monterey Peninsula, host to multiple U.S. Open Championships. Known for its dramatic ocean views and challenging holes along the Pacific coastline.

holes_data.description: Opening hole with a slight dogleg right. Fairway bunkers guard the landing area. Approach shot to a well-bunkered green.
Reachable par 5 for long hitters. Water hazard on the right side of the fairway. Second shot must carry over water to reach the green.
Straightaway par 4 with a narrow fairway. Trees line both sides. Approach shot to an elevated green with deep bunkers.
Short par 4 with a dogleg left. Risk/reward hole where players can try to drive the green or lay up for a short approach.
Long par 3 over a deep ravine. Wind can be a significant factor. Large green with multiple tiers.
Challenging par 5 with a narrow fairway. Out of bounds left, trees right. Three-shot hole for most players.
Famous short par 3 with ocean backdrop. Small green surrounded by bunkers. Club selection is crucial despite the short distance.
Long par 4 with a dramatic ocean view. Dogleg right with a narrow landing area. Approach shot to a green perched above the ocean.
Uphill par 4 with a blind tee shot. Fairway slopes from right to left. Large green with subtle breaks.
Long par 4 with ocean views. Narrow fairway with bunkers on both sides. Approach shot to a green with ocean backdrop.
Medium-length par 4 with a dogleg left. Trees guard the corner. Approach shot to a well-bunkered green.
Long par 3 with ocean views. Wind can be a major factor. Large green with multiple pin positions.
Challenging par 4 with a narrow fairway. Out of bounds left, trees right. Approach shot to an elevated green.
Long par 5 with a dogleg right. Three-shot hole for most players. Well-bunkered green with ocean views.
Medium-length par 4 with a slight dogleg left. Fairway bunkers guard the landing area. Approach shot to a large green.
Straightaway par 4 with ocean views. Narrow fairway with bunkers on both sides. Approach shot to a green with ocean backdrop.
Iconic par 3 with ocean backdrop. Small green surrounded by bunkers. Wind and distance control are crucial.
Famous finishing hole along the ocean. Dogleg left with a narrow fairway. Second shot must carry over the ocean to reach the green.
